intro: Biscutella subspathulata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf biscuitroot, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many cruciferous plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically yellow or white, arranged in clusters, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Biscutella subspathulata is adapted to arid and rocky environments, making it a resilient species in harsh climates.
